intro: Cecropia leucophaea, commonly known as the white-leafed cecropia, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a fast-growing, deciduous tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, smooth, gray bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures, and its fruits are three-winged capsules containing seeds. Cecropia leucophaea is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
